stanza.line: My tongue-tied muse in manners holds her stillstill
While comments of your praise richly compiledcompiled
Reserve their character with golden quillquill
And precious phrase by all the Muses filedfiled
I think good thoughts whilst other write good wordswords
And like unlettered clerk still cry AmenAmen
To every hymn that able spirit affordsaffords
In polished form of well refined penpen
Hearing you praised I say tis so tis truetrue
And to the most of praise add something moremore
But that is in my thought whose love to youyou
(Though words come hindmost) holds his rank beforebefore
Then others for the breath of words respectrespect
Me for my dumb thoughts speaking in effecteffect
